title: How will COVID-19 affect the implementation of SDGs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi! It is still early to know and also every country, city and region might experience it differently. On one hand, I can see people more aware of how interconnected we are with one another and how dependent we are from Nature. As I come for the fashion world, allow me to say that we are intertwined like threads in a loom. I think this quarantine is allowing the planet to rest from our extreme pollution habits and us to reconsider how we want to do things after. Now we get to appreciate a hug, a kiss, a beautiful sunset, a tasty tomato… Before, we were running trying to be productive. That said, the economic impact of COVID is going to be huge and that will definitively affect how the governments and entities get funded to help some programs. Climate change related SDG´s might get a fix by the resting period, but the Decent Work and Economic Growth (SDG8) Zero hunger (SDG2), End Poverty (SDG1), are going to need more help-and funds- than ever. Jobs are being cut at unprecedented rates and that can lead to a downward spiral difficult to revamp. Recently, I wrote an article about how coronavirus was affecting sustainable fashion businesses in particular, in case you might want to see how it might impact fashion in general and also in this niche. How Coronavirus Is Affecting Sustainable Fashion Businesses | Luxiders But truth to be told… we wouldn't know until Covid is just a memory. The impacts are very much aligned with the duration of the quarantines and how the society and the business react to them. It is not the same to stop for 15 days than for 4 months.
